title: Mastering C++ For Loops

metadata.title: Hint Panel
metadata.description: Progressive hint disclosure with multiple tiers of guidance for C++ for loops

hints.text: A for loop has three parts: initialization, condition, and increment. The initialization runs once, the condition is checked before each iteration, and the increment happens after each iteration.
The basic syntax is: for(int i = 0; i < limit; i++) { statements; }. The variable i starts at 0, loops while i is less than limit, and increases by 1 each time.
To print numbers 1 to 5, write: for(int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { cout << i << endl; }. Start i at 1, check i <= 5, and increment i each time.
